description: Raising level of workshop roof at rear of building and formation of canopy to house oil tanks and compressor unit
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | As measured at the boundaries of the application site, the noise level shall not exceed Noise Rating NR35 (as depicted on the Noise Rating Curves issued by the International Organisation for Standardisation) at any time.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties. | All landscaping shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development.  Any trees or plant which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plan No. 1803/013D shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site. | The areas shown on the approved plans No. 1803/013D as parking, access, loading,  unloading and manoeuvring shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only. 	 REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site.
